name: chicagotribune
text:
Chicago’s new top cop got testy when asked about the city's violent weekend; so did Mayor Lightfoot when asked whether she still has confidence in him.

Here are today’s top stories in Chicago politics, from @byldonovan: https://t.co/llbi9cWhJQ

name: chicagotribune
text: COVID-19 cases top 100,000 in Florida as US sees surge in infections in states across South and West https://t.co/BLIkunyYGW

name: chicagotribune
text:
Since @RexHuppke moved to Chicago 18 years ago, there have been roughly 7,000 homicides. How can the city let the carnage go on?

“The rich and powerful of Chicago have the gall to claim this city’s heart is breaking. This city’s heart seems unbreakable.” https://t.co/PpzDlm2YpS

name: chicagotribune
text:
A Chicago Board of Education member denies a newly released state watchdog report that he did campaign work while on the clock as an auditor for the Illinois Department of Employment Security
https://t.co/8A1vMYG1A3

name: chicagotribune
text: The Illinois Supreme Court announced on Monday that it would recruit a chief diversity and inclusion officer, acknowledging a need to address racism and to address “frailties in the disposition of justice” affecting people of color https://t.co/pLsq7xsshz

name: chicagotribune
text: After George Floyd’s death, where does Chicago draw the line on police chokeholds? https://t.co/RDr059RstE

name: chicagotribune
text: Seattle’s mayor said Monday that the city is working with the community to bring the “Capitol Hill Occupied Protest” zone to an end https://t.co/neGg1LcYCA

name: chicagotribune
text: “Cancel the race. It’s that simple. If NASCAR is really that worried, really that appalled by the vile action of the person who placed a noose in driver Bubba Wallace’s pit stall, show it. Put that money where that virtue signaling mouth is.” @TribuneKevin https://t.co/WTamYzJLsi

name: chicagotribune
text: The COVID-19 pandemic has been devastating for Chicago's theater community. Theater needs relief, as much if not more than many other industries, writes Lou Raizin, president of Broadway In Chicago. https://t.co/GvaTQdrgn8

name: chicagotribune
text: Let's create more national holidays that give us a chance to reflect on our history, not on individuals, historian @PatrickReardon writes in @ChiTribOpinions. https://t.co/NwT3vobntJ

name: chicagotribune
text: The family of Mekhi James, a 3-year-old who was killed over the weekend, joined in a small vigil in Austin on Monday: “Another mother has to bury another son and another dream dies” https://t.co/JjPX80Nwr5

name: chicagotribune
text: Despite student demands to cut ties with Chicago police, DePaul University said its educational relationship will continue https://t.co/huZecp2ZaV
